required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real-World Effectiveness of Afatinib (Gilotrif) Following Immunotherapy in the Treatment of Metastatic, Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Lung: A Multi-Site Retrospective Chart Review Study in the U.S.
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of Real-World Outcomes Associated With Afatinib (Gilotrif) Use in Patients With Solid Tumors Harboring NRG1 Gene Fusions

brief_summary.textblock: Characteristics of patients with Neuregulin-1 (NRG1) gene fusion-positive solid tumors treated with afatinib, and characteristics of those treated with another systemic therapy.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients with a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR)
primary_outcome.description: out of all patients (CR+PR/all patients) at initial response assessment and best response

secondary_outcome.description: time from initial response (for any patient with a complete, partial, or stable disease response initially) until the earliest of either disease progression or death
time from initial response (for any patient with a complete or partial response initially) until the earliest of either disease progression or death

secondary_outcome.measure: Time from initiation of a line of therapy until discontinuation for any reason
Time from initiation of a line of therapy until discontinuation due to disease progression
Time from initiation of a line of therapy until disease progression or death
Time from initiation of any therapy in the metastatic setting until death
Number of patients experiencing an adverse event

study_pop.textblock: Providers will select patients meeting the study eligibility criteria as described below. Providers will be asked to select eligible patients chronologically, starting with the first patient who first initiated any line of afatinib or chemotherapy, on or after 01/01/2017 through 03/31/2020.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults, 18 years of age or older, at the time of diagnosis with any solid tumor.
- Confirmed NRG1 gene fusion in any solid tumor.
- Initiated afatinib or other systemic therapy (in any line of therapy) for treatment of a solid tumor with NRG1 gene fusion on or after 01/01/2017 through 03/31/2020.
- Followed up for â‰¥3 months after initiation of afatinib or other systemic therapy (unless deceased prior to 3 months of follow-up).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with any Tyrosine kinase inhibitor (TKI)/ErbB-directed therapy other than afatinib
